info.title: 8x8 Contact Center Chat API
info.description:
Integration with the 8x8 Contact Center (CC) Chat API enables you to:
* Respond in real time to your customer's chat inquiries
* Initiate chat conversations between your customers and agents
* Quickly access customer account information in order to better facilitate and enhance your agent's chat session
* Allocate your company's resources to best address customer chat requirements
* Review conversation information between your customer and the chat message receiving bot
* Forward system events (e.g., agent joining conversation, agent ending conversation) to chat seesion stakeholders
* Manage customer chats in your agent's supported language(s) or use the automatic translation tool

The 2 way API communication is achieved by using callbacks from 8x8's platform to your subscribed URIs.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Creates access tokens for endpoint access.

tags.name: WebHooks
tags.description: Enables webhook definitions that can be associated to channels.

tags.name: JwkKeys
tags.description: An API that offers JWK public key access to customers.

tags.name: Channels
tags.description: Enables ChatAPI channel registration and association with a webhook containing channel.

post.summary: The endpoint used to validate that the webhook is working and reachable.

get.description: Returns the public JWK that can be used to validate the message signature.

type.description: A string that identifies the Error code class.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this problem occurrence.

detail.description: Could not locate the resource. The resource may not exist or is not accessible.
detail.example: Resource may not exist or is not accessible.

instance.description: The specific error code that points to the problem. It is a subclass of the Type error code class.

get.summary: Retrieves all customer Chat API channels.
get.description: Retrieves all customer Chat API channels based on the provided access token information.

post.description: Create a new channel for a customer.

delete.description: Deletes ChatAPI channel by the provided Id.

get.summary: Returns all conversations belonging to the customer.
get.description: Returns a list of all conversations belonging to the customer that comply with the provided filters.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The order results that are based on create time.

post.description: Creates a new transaction in the Contact Center and returns a conversation Id as an identifier that can be used later on to send messages to agent and also close the ongoing transaction.

get.description: Retrieves all the participants that joined during the lifespan of the conversation.

delete.description: When customers leave a conversation. It translates to a current interaction that is being terminated by the customer.

204.description: Confirms that the customer left the interaction.

default.description: Confirms that the customer left the interaction.

get.description: Retrieves the conversation messages that took place during the lifepan of the conversation.

post.description: Send a message to a conversation represented by the provided ID.

CreateTransactionRequestBody.description: Defines the create transaction request payload.

SendMessageToConversationRequest.description: Defines the send message request payload.

IdempotencyKeyOptional.description: Makes a request itempotent in case of retries due to outages or timeouts.

SortByOptional.description: Attribute on which sorting direction is applied.

FilterOptional.description: Filter for a query in FIQL format.

refresh_token_expires_in.description: Expirtion time for refresh token if present

api_product_list.description: API product list for wich you can use the token.

access_token.description: Access token you will have to use for accesing the resta of the endpoints.

application_name.description: ID of [API key](/contactcenter/v2.0/docs/api-key) pair generated in Admin Console

status.description: Status of the application (API key pair with ID of application_name)

channelId.description: Channel ID for which the transaction will be created.

name.description: Sets the Contact Center customerâ€™s name. The Contact Center agent views this name in the chat conversation. For example: John Doe

customer.description:
The attached data which contains customer details. The data fields include `senderName`, `customerId`, `email`, `company`, `caseId` and `language` are predefined; however, you can also add any metadata. Any information about the customer can be attached to a Chat API conversation, and it will be shown to Contact Center agent as part of transaction details in the chat panel.
For example: { `senderName: John Doe email: john.doe@email.com language: en myCustomProperty: customValue anyKey: anyValue` }

interactionId.description: The interaction Id durring which this message was written.

originalText.description: The message written by the sender.

translatedText.description: The message read by the receiver.

participantId.description: The Id of the user who wrote the message.

uri.description: The client URI used to send system events and messages.

version.description: The notification version used for testing the URL

id.description: The Channel ID for which the transaction will be created.

Language.description:
The language of the customer. Based on this property the customer is assigned to an agent who speaks their language.

The default value is English (`en`).
